intro: Cyperus carinalaevis, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed flatsedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the sedge family (Cyperaceae) and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, ribbon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in wetland environments, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
